Culinary Profile & Uses

1. Flavour and Form ‘Air-Breather Mini’ offers a distinctive, rich flavor often described as a cross between traditional catfish and freshwater eel, with a sweet, earthy undertone and no muddiness. The flesh is pinkish-white, exceptionally firm, and almost boneless when properly fileted, with a dense, satisfying chew. The fish has a characteristic elongated body, dark gray-black coloration, and the signature suprabranchial organ that allows it to process atmospheric air.

2. The Rich, Meaty Specialist This catfish’s bold flavor and steak-like texture make it ideal for hearty preparations and global cuisines that value substantive fish.

  • Blackened or Cajun-Spiced: The premier preparation - the firm flesh stands up to intense spice rubs and high-heat searing, developing a flavorful crust while staying moist inside.
  • Curries and Stews: A cornerstone of Southeast Asian dishes like Vietnamese ca kho to; its firm texture holds shape during long, slow cooking, absorbing complex flavors without falling apart.
  • Grilled or Smoked: Its high oil content and dense flesh make it superb for grilling whole or smoking, resulting in a flaky, flavorful product reminiscent of smoked mullet.
  • Fried Catfish Nuggets: The classic preparation, where its firmness ensures juicy, non-greasy results with a crisp coating.

3. The Growth & Harvest Cycle ‘Air-Breather Mini’ is a rapid-growing, incredibly hardy species. Its air-breathing capability reduces energy spent on gill ventilation, directing more calories toward growth. It is tolerant of a wide range of water qualities. Reared in a BioFlocLite™ system, a cohort provides a rapid, efficient harvest, yielding 15-20 fish per 100-liter barrel over a 4-month cycle, reaching optimal harvest size of 180g in just 3-4 months from fingerlings.
